string.text: Thank you for using Party AI Controls! To access the new configuration panel, press CTRL+P!
Allow troops to be converted to types matching your party template. Cost is adjusted if needed. If you disable this, you should not use party templates to recruit troops that are far away.
If you are the ruler of your kingdom, manage parties for the entire kingdom instead of just your clan. Kingdom parties will stop following your settings as soon as you disable this.
Allow this party to join kingdom armies. Even with this setting disabled the party will be allowed to join your army.
Allow this party to donate troops to friendly garrisons.
Allow this party to raid hostile villages. Parties will leave armies that are raiding, refunding the influence to the army leader.
Allow this party to take enemy lords prisoner after battle. If disabled, parties will release captured lords.
Select a new template for {LEADER}'s Party
Show all heroes that can lead parties. Useful for assigning settings for any potential hero that might be a leader.
Choose which type of order to create
Select which party to copy settings from
Select which settings you would like to copy.
You may select more than one option.
Select which parties to copy settings to
Are you sure you want to delete the template {TEMPLATE}?
Enter a name for your new party troop template.
There is already a template with that name.
Select a new template for {LEADER}'s Party
{PARTY} is no longer {ORDER} because they were called to {ARMY}
Let me inspect your party's inventory.
{PARTY} is no longer {ORDER} because their food supplies ran low.

Patrol an area around the target settlement. The party will visit villages and towns to restock its troops and supplies. Bandits and other enemies will be chased down if the party leader believes they can be caught. The party will defend villages and castles/towns within its patrol radius from raids and sieges.
Stay in the garrison of the settlement. The party may make occassional visits to other settlements for food if there is not enough food in the settlement to buy.
{PARTY} is no longer {ORDER} because their food supplies ran low.
The party or army will besiege the target settlement. The order will be cleared upon capturing the city or by the attacking army being defeated.
This hero is an army leader. Orders given to their party will apply to their entire army.
Allow this party to besiege towns and castles. If disabled, parties will leave armies that are sieging, refunding the influence to the army leader.
